pr_title: Forward-port Stats ViewPager usage to ViewPager2

timeline.bodyText: Is there a better way to do this? A static, mutable reference to Android internals seems like it will get nasty.
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
Tracing through this code and its purpose, there was a question at the actual part where it did something saying "hey, do we need these now that we don't have bitmaps anymore?", and when I wholesale deleted all the code related to this, then tested it by changing the deck and timeframe I was calculating stats on, it was just fine - dynamically updated charts exactly as you'd expect.
So I purged it all.
replies.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: Wait, the full purge failed in testing, however Today I Learned how to correctly add a data observer to ViewPager2 Adapters and I used that knowledge to implement it the correct way
replies.author: mikehardy

timeline.bodyText: Just to note: requireActivity() now exists if you can guarantee that the call will occur when the activity is valid.
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: That's superior I think. I'm altering all of them to requireActivity
replies.author: mikehardy

timeline.bodyText:
This previously did not properly cancel the task (or the task did not handle cancellation). #6192
Stats for a big collection, exit, then change collection path -> crash.
Confirming that nothing has changed yet (and if you know the cause, would save me a bit of time debugging).

replies.bodyText: Nothing has been done here - if you don't have it peeled off to a separate issue, you could do so if you have a stack or similar. Seems like changing collection path is pretty rare so investing time there right now and complicating this PR for a fix (I can see it could be a problem...) doesn't seem like a good use of time, so I'm going to leave it at the "nothing has been done here" state
